Generation IV.Diamond: To eat, it deftly shucks nuts with its two tails. It rarely uses its arms now.
Generation IV.Pearl: They work in large colonies and make rings by linking their tails, apparently in friendship.
Generation IV.Platinum: Split into two, the tails are so adept at handling and doing things, Ambipom rarely uses its hands.
Generation IV.HeartGold: They live on large trees. They are said to communicate by connecting their tails to those of others.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: It is very difficult to dodge the consecutive strikes of its two tails.

Generation V.Black: Split into two, the tails are so adept at handling and doing things, Ambipom rarely uses its hands.
Generation V.White: Split into two, the tails are so adept at handling and doing things, Ambipom rarely uses its hands.
Generation V.Black 2: Split into two, the tails are so adept at handling and doing things, Ambipom rarely uses its hands.
Generation V.White 2: Split into two, the tails are so adept at handling and doing things, Ambipom rarely uses its hands.

Generation VI.X: They work in large colonies and make rings by linking their tails, apparently in friendship.
Generation VI.Y: To eat, it deftly shucks nuts with its two tails. It rarely uses its arms now.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: They work in large colonies and make rings by linking their tails, apparently in friendship.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: To eat, it deftly shucks nuts with its two tails. It rarely uses its arms now.

Generation VII.Ultra Sun: In their search for comfortable trees, they get into territorial disputes with groups of Passimian. They win about half the time.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: It uses its tails for everything. If it wraps both of its tails around you and gives you a squeeze, that's proof it really likes you.

Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: To eat, it deftly shucks nuts with its two tails. It rarely uses its arms now.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: They work in large colonies and make rings by linking their tails, apparently in friendship.
Generation VIII.Legends: Arceus: To affirm their kinship, members of this species will form a ring by linking their newly doubled tails together. On rare occasions, humans have been accepted into such rings.

Generation IX.Scarlet: They live on large trees. They are said to communicate by connecting their tails to those of others.
Generation IX.Violet: Split into two, the tails are so adept at handling and doing things that Ambipom rarely uses its hands.

Generation VIII.Legends: Arceus: Cobalt Coastlands : Aipom Hill , Hideaway Bay , massive mass outbreaks Coronet Highlands : Space-time distortions Alabaster Icelands : Avalanche Slopes , near Icebound Falls , near Arena's Approach , near Avalugg's Legacy , Heart's Crag , massive mass outbreaks
